Math functions for vertex manipulation.

Static Variables

addVertex(default,method) : p_oV : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_oW : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> sandy.core.data.Vertex

Adds the two vertices.

Clones a vertex.

Computes the cross product the two vertices.

dot(default,method) : p_oV : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_oW : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> Float

Computes the dot product of the two vertices.

getInstance(default,method) : Void -> VertexMath

Returns an instance of this class.

Call this method to get an instance of VertexMath

linearGradientMatrix(default,method) : p_oV0 : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_oV1 : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_oV2 : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_nR0 : Float -> p_nR1 : Float -> p_nR2 : Float -> ?p_oMatrix : flash.geom.Matrix -> flash.geom.Matrix

Calculates linear gradient matrix from three vertices and ratios

This function expects vertices to be ordered in such a way that p_nR0 < p_nR1 < p_n2. Ratios can be scaled by any positive factor; see beginGradientFill documentation for ratios meaning.

negate(default,method) : p_oV : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> sandy.core.data.Vertex

Computes the opposite of a vertex.

The "opposite" vertex is a vertex where all components are multiplied by -1

sub(default,method) : p_oV : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> p_oW : sandy.core.data.Vertex -> sandy.core.data.Vertex

Substracts one vertices from another
